info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 10:32AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Little Cypress Bayou Near Jefferson affecting Marion and Harrison Counties.
For the Little Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Cypress Bayou near Jefferson.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding to continue for several days.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Thursday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 03/05/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1045 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
